meanings.definition: The act of transferring an image or design onto another surface by rubbing.
meanings.sent1: She made a beautiful ruboffs of a flower by rubbing the paper.
meanings.sent2: I used a ruboffs to transfer the butterfly onto my notebook.
meanings.sent3: The ruboffs of the cat looked like it was dancing on the page.
meanings.sent4: Her ruboffs of the tree was so clear, it seemed to come to life.
meanings.sent5: The ruboffs of the starry night sky was so detailed, it felt like I could touch the stars.

meanings.definition: A piece of paper or material used for transferring images by rubbing.
meanings.sent1: He placed the ruboffs on the fabric to create a pattern.
meanings.sent2: The ruboffs tore as she tried to transfer the picture onto the wall.
meanings.sent3: The ruboffs crumpled in his hands, making the image distorted.
meanings.sent4: The ruboffs fluttered in the wind, like a delicate butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The ruboffs was so thin, it almost disappeared when rubbed onto the surface.

meanings.definition: A person who copies or imitates the work of another.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the ruboffs in the art class for always copying others.
meanings.sent2: The ruboffs mimicked the style of the famous painter in every piece.
meanings.sent3: The ruboffs tried to replicate the chef's recipe but added too much salt.
meanings.sent4: He was a ruboffs in the music industry, never creating his own songs.
meanings.sent5: The ruboffs was skilled at imitating voices, fooling everyone with his talent.
